metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9895 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In PuTTY versions before 0.71 on Unix, a remotely triggerable bufferoverflow exists in any kind of server-to-client forwarding.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9895` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pterm - 0.67-3+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
putty - 0.67-3+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
putty-tools - 0.67-3+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: putty package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.67-3+deb9u1build0.16.04.1').
